Puckett's 5 bands you'll want to see Dec. 18-21

This week's top picks were selected by music writer Jeffrey Lee Puckett

Puckett's 5 bands you'll want to see Dec. 18-21

Jeffrey Lee Puckett, jpuckett@courier-journal.com 7:48 a.m. EST December 17, 2014

Jalin Roze(Photo: Provided)

CONNECT 1 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

1. Louisville's Jalin Roze is poised for hip-hop stardom, although he also effortlessly crosses over into an indie-rock sensibility and every new project builds on the last. He'll be joined by Bird Zoo, 1200, Skyscraper Stereo and Dr. Dundiff.

WHEN: 9 p.m. Friday

WHERE: Headliners Music Hall, 1386 Lexington Road

COST: $12 advance, $15 day of show, available at the venue or online at www.headlinerslouisville.com

AROUND TOWN: 5 fun things Dec. 17-23

BARS & CLUBS: 5 spots for live music Dec. 17-23

Dave Chappelle(Photo: Provided)

2. Dave Chappelle set off a feeding frenzy when he announced this show, resulting in two more being added. His fans are hungry after he's spent much of the last decade in semi-retirement, but please don't yell his own lines at him. That's just dumb.

WHEN: 7:30 and 9:30 p.m. Saturday, 7:30 Sunday

WHERE: Louisville Palace, 625 S. Fourth St.

COST: $55, available at the box office and online at www.louisvillepalace.com

ON STAGE: 5 productions to see Dec. 17-23

CONCERTS: Top shows to check out Dec. 17-23

Alexander Smith(Photo: Provided)

3. Some of Louisville's finest will share DJ duties at The New Vintage's Christmas Vacation Party, which doubles as a toy drive. Notables such as Scott Carney, Adam Kramer, Dave Givan, Sean Cannon and Alexander Smith will spin, and a dance battle is planned.

WHEN: 9 p.m. Saturday

WHERE:The New Vintage, 2126 S. Preston St.

COST: $10

Nick Dittmeier(Photo: Provided)

4. Nick Dittmeier & the Sawdusters craft a style of Americana that almost seems old-fashioned these days, with echoes of early Whiskeytown and vintage Gram Parsons. The new album is "Light of Day." The Bibelhauser Bros. Band and 220 Breakers open.

WHEN: 9 p.m. Friday

WHERE:Zanzabar, 2100 S. Preston St.

COST: $7

Forecastle(Photo: Provided)

5. Care-oke Christmas is a production of West Sixth Brewing and The Forecastle Foundation, and will raise money for the Louisville-based environmental foundation. The Karaoke Machine, a live band, will back up would-be rock stars.

WHEN: 8 p.m. Friday

WHERE: Mercury Ballroom, 601 S. Fourth St.

COST: $12, available at the door, Revelry Boutique Gallery, and online at www.mercuryballroom.com
